intro: Sabicea rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-stained sabicea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which includes many legumes and nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
